Everytime a new build is executed, this error occurs. The problem is that
cocoon.xconf is touched although there might be no changes at all.
I will attach a patch for the build targets that checks if cocoon.xconf has
really changed, and if not, assures that this file is not copied to the wepapp dir.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text:
Note that you have to specify an 'unless' clause in your xml patch file.
E.g.:

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<xconf xpath="/cocoon/input-modules"
unless="/cocoon/input-modules/component-instance[@name='unizh']">

  <component-instance
                        name="unizh"
                        logger="sitemap.modules.input.unizh"
                       
class="ch.unizh.lenya.cms.cocoon.components.modules.input.UnizhModule"/>
</xconf>

Otherwise, the patch get applied several times.
